intro: Sphinctanthus longiflorus, commonly known as the long-flowered sphinctanthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, with long, slender petals that contribute to its common name. Sphinctanthus longiflorus is adapted to survive in dry conditions, often with deep root systems to access groundwater.
